wikipedia_page.main: David Wotherspoon (9 April 1849 – 28 February 1906) was a Scottish footballer who played as a defender.

response: Queen's Park formed the Scottish Football Association on 13 March 1873, with eight other clubs. The match against Dumbreck on 25 October was the first match to be played at the first Hampden Park.The Men with the Educated Feet, F.H.C Robertson, Page 10 It was also the first match which saw Queen's Park players wear their custom black and white hooped jerseys, which lent the club the nickname of 'The Spiders'. David Wotherspoon, a Queen's Park player and committee member, has been credited with the introduction of the black and white hoops. Most importantly, it was the first Scottish Cup tie and Scottish competitive match for the club and Queen's won 7–0. In the final, Queen's defeated Clydesdale 2–0 at Hampden.
* 9 April – David Wotherspoon (d. 1906), Scotland international in 1872–73 who played in the first two official international matches.
* David Wotherspoon (footballer, born 1849) (1849–1906), Scotland international who played for Queen's Park and Clydesdale
